alert.note: Alert for Coconino (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 23 at 5:28PM MST until July 23 at 7:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Pipeline Burn Scar in Coconino County in north central Arizona... * Until 700 PM MST. * At 515 PM MST, trained weather spotters reported flooding along, west and east of US 89 in Doney Park. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Hutchison Acres and Lockett Meadow Campground. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Government Wash. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Avoid recently burned areas and downstream locations. Life-threatening flooding of creeks, roads and normally dry washes will occur. Rockslides and mudslides will likely occur in steep terrain. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
